original_text: We sat down next to each other, but David wouldn't look at me. He lowered his head what he was thinking. I had high hopes for him so I wanted to let him join the cross-country. I comforted him in a soothing voice, "you have work so hard for this event. I hope your work hard is rewarding, I will support you forever." My words like a warm stream rushed his being. David raised his eyes meet my eyes with his eyes sparkling with confident. David felt inspired. I was pleased beyond description that I can light his strong determination. David was thinking for a while, "I hope I can try it." He laughed, his eyes shining with excitement. I pulled him into my arms, "I believe you can do it." I watched as David moved up to the starting line with the other runners. But David still had butterflies in his stomach and his hands were sweaty. With starting competition. So nervous was him that he was slow.

detailed_errors.original_sentence: He lowered his head what he was thinking.
detailed_errors.correction: He lowered his head, lost in thought.
detailed_errors.explanation: 原句缺少连词或分词结构，导致句子不完整。应使用过去分词短语表示状态。
detailed_errors.advanced_suggestion: He bowed his head, deep in contemplation.

detailed_errors.original_sentence: you have work so hard for this event.
detailed_errors.correction: you have worked so hard for this event.
detailed_errors.explanation: have后接过去分词构成现在完成时，work应变为worked。
detailed_errors.advanced_suggestion: you've put in so much effort for this race.

detailed_errors.original_sentence: with his eyes sparkling with confident.
detailed_errors.correction: with his eyes sparkling with confidence.
detailed_errors.explanation: confident是形容词，此处需用名词confidence作介词宾语。
detailed_errors.advanced_suggestion: his eyes gleaming with unwavering confidence.

detailed_errors.original_sentence: So nervous was him that he was slow.
detailed_errors.correction: So nervous was he that he was slow.
detailed_errors.explanation: 倒装句中主语应为he，不能用him。
detailed_errors.advanced_suggestion: So overwhelmed by nerves was he that he started slowly.

detailed_errors.explanation: with不能引导时间状语，应使用as或when。
detailed_errors.advanced_suggestion: When the starting gun fired, the race began.

optimizations.original_sentence: My words like a warm stream rushed his being.
optimizations.correction: My words flowed like a warm stream, touching his soul.
optimizations.explanation: 增加动词flowed和touching，使画面感更强，情感更细腻。

optimizations.original_sentence: I was pleased beyond description that I can light his strong determination.
optimizations.correction: I was overjoyed to see that I had ignited his inner strength.
optimizations.explanation: 使用overjoyed替代pleased beyond description，更地道；ignite比light更贴切用于抽象概念。

optimizations.original_sentence: But David still had butterflies in his stomach and his hands were sweaty.
optimizations.correction: Yet David's heart pounded with anxiety, his palms slick with sweat.
optimizations.explanation: pounded with anxiety比butterflies更生动；slick with sweat比were sweaty更具文学性。

material_reuse_guide.processing_direction: 可将此素材拓展为议论文，探讨‘真正的胜利在于参与’或‘教育的本质是点燃希望’等主题。
material_reuse_guide.expansion_ideas: 加入更多细节：如David训练的艰辛、其他同学的态度变化、比赛中的具体表现等，增强感染力。

revised_text:
We sat down next to each other, but David wouldn't look at me. He lowered his head, lost in thought. I had high hopes for him, so I wanted to encourage him to join the cross-country team. In a soothing voice, I said, 'You've worked so hard for this event. I hope your efforts will be rewarded, and I'll always support you.' My words flowed like a warm stream, touching his soul. David raised his eyes to meet mine, his gaze sparkling with confidence. He felt inspired. I was overjoyed to see that I had ignited his inner strength.

David paused for a moment, then whispered, 'I hope I can try it.' A smile broke across his face, his eyes shining with excitement. I pulled him into my arms and whispered, 'I believe you can do it.' As the race began, David stood at the starting line with the others. Yet his heart pounded with anxiety, his palms slick with sweat. So nervous was he that he started slowly. But with every step, his courage grew, and he ran not just for victory, but for the joy of participation.
